Technique: FORMED BY HAND; PAINTED; ENGRAVED; FAYENCE; ENGRAVED; WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Shabti of queen Akheqa
Description: This shabti in greenish faience was discovered in a pyramid at Nuri. The statuette, which bears the hieroglyphic text of Chapter 6 from the Book of the Dead, is in the name of Akheqa, daughter of  king Aspelta (see E.6170A-B) and wife of  king Arametelqa. She wears a long wig crowned by the skin of a vulture. In her hands, she holds a pair of hoes. The left shoulder supports a square sack suspended by a cord.
